intro: Tenoria juncea, commonly known as the common tenoria, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and has distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. Its small, greenish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Tenoria juncea is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along riverbanks.
